Name: Nyx Assassin
Bio:
Deep in the Archive of Ultimyr, shelved between scholarly treatises on dragon cladistics and books of untranslatable spells, there is an ancient tome of entomological curiosities. Compiled by scholars, the book describes the telepathic talents of the zealot scarab, a strange species of social insect with abilities unique to all the seven planes. 

 Unlike most grubs of his colony, Nyx Assassin did not arise from metamorphosis with the plodding thoughts and blunted appendages common to the worker caste of his kind. For his was a special transformation, guided by the grace of Nyx. He was the chosen one, selected from the many and anointed with an extract of the queen goddess herself. Not all survive the dark blessing of the queen’s chamber, but he emerged with a penetrating mind, and dagger-like claws–his razor sharp mandibles raking the air while his thoughts projected directly into the minds of those around him. Of all zealot scarabs, he alone was selected for the highest calling. After his metamorphosis, he was reborn, by grace of Nyx, with abilities which shaped him for one thing and one thing only: to kill in the name of his goddess.

Abilities.affects:
ABILITY: Point Target
AFFECTS: Enemy Units
DAMAGE TYPE: Magical
PIERCES SPELL IMMUNITY: No
Abilities.desc: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units are hurled into the air, then are stunned and take damage when they fall.
Abilities.notes:
The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 700 range.
Impale cannot be blocked by Linken's Sphere.
Abilities.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.

Abilities.affects:
ABILITY: Unit Target
AFFECTS: Enemy Heroes
DAMAGE TYPE: Magical
PIERCES SPELL IMMUNITY: No
Abilities.desc: Destroys the target hero's mana equal to a multiplier of its Intelligence, and deals damage equal to the mana burned.
Abilities.notes:
Bonus damage is based on base damage and that given by primary attribute.
Self-cast with Scepter will make it behave in the non-Scepter form, without jumping.
Enchant Totem has True Strike.
Abilities.lore: The tome in Ultimyr describes one scarab with the ability eat away at the mind of lesser beings.

Abilities.affects:
ABILITY: No Target
DAMAGE TYPE: Pure
PIERCES SPELL IMMUNITY: No
Abilities.desc:
When activated while above ground, Spiked Carapace reflects and negates damage dealt to Nyx Assassin (max once from each source), as well as stunning the source of the damage. Activating Spiked Carapace will not break Vendetta invisibility.

While Burrowed, Spiked Carapace instantly stuns nearby enemies when cast.
Abilities.notes:
The damage is calculated after all reductions.
Spiked Carapace will only trigger on damage from other player controlled units.
Abilities.lore: While their carapace is relatively thin, it's guarded by a retractable field of razor-sharp spikes.

Abilities.affects:
ABILITY: No Target
DAMAGE TYPE: Physical
PIERCES SPELL IMMUNITY: Yes
Abilities.desc: Allows Nyx Assassin to become invisible and gain a speed bonus.  If Nyx Assassin attacks to break the invisibility, massive bonus damage is dealt with the attack.
Abilities.notes:
Has a 0 second fadetime.
If a spell is used to break the invisibility, or the invisibility expires, the bonus damage is lost.
Abilities.lore: The scarab kills for the glory of his queen.

Abilities.desc: Nyx Assassin buries himself beneath the battlefield over a short duration. Once burrowed, Spiked Carapace instantly stuns nearby enemies when cast, the range of Mana Burn and Impale is increased, and Impale's cooldown is decreased. While burrowed, Nyx Assassin is stationary, unable to attack, and invisible. His health and mana regeneration are also increased, and he gains damage reduction from all damage sources.
Abilities.attribute:
BURROW HEALTH/MANA REGEN: 1.5%
BURROW DAMAGE REDUCTION: 40%
BURROW MANA BURN RANGE: 1050
BURROW IMPALE RANGE: 1225
BURROW IMPALE COOLDOWN: 7
BURROW SPIKED CARAPACE RANGE: 300
Abilities.lore: Some castes of zealot scarab are known to create small burrows to lie in wait, ready to ambush their prey.
Some castes of zealot scarab are known to create small burrows to lie in wait, ready to ambush their prey.
